document_title: Chronic tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Children suffer from tonsillitis very often, although this disease is rarely observed under 2 years of age.
Streptococcus tonsillitis usually occurs in children 5 to 15 years old, while viral tonsillitis is more common in younger children.
Many studies report that the average rate of carrier status in schoolchildren for group A Streptococcus is about 15.9%.
